Project1.title: Product Cards
Project1.description: This was my first homework assignment. It was to practice with what little we know and improve upon it. It was made with a group where we talked about how to make this.
Project1.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

Project2.title: GameSafe
Project2.description: This Website was my Front-end Capstone. It was made as a games tracker for people who want to know which games they have or do not have. It also gives the user more information on the games that they want to see on the website.
Project2.technologiesUsed: React, JavaScript, CSS, SCSS, Firebase, Version Control with Github, Webpack, ES6 modules, Bootstrap, JSON, Third-party Api

Project3.title: Pet Adoption
Project3.description: This is a Pet Adoption website. We were told to use Javascript to make the html and not hard code it into the html. We used JavaScript DOM Loops.
Project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

Project4.title: Sorting Hat
Project4.description: This website uses full CRUD. We were told to create a website where we could add a student to the form and be able to delete that student later.
Project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

Project5.title: Sports Roster
Project5.description: The web app is designed to showcase off the full CRUD capabilities using React. It is an Overwatch team roster that anyone can add or remove players from.
Project5.technologiesUsed: React, JavaScript, CSS, SCSS, Firebase, Version Control with Github, Webpack, ES6 modules, Bootstrap, JSON

Project6.title: Firebase Cows
Project6.description: This website is our first ever deployed one. This website was used to teach us how to use axios.
Project6.technologiesUsed: HTML5, CSS, SASS, Bootstrap, Vanilla JavaScript, JQuery, Webpack, ES6 modules, Version Control with Github
